stanza.line: A woman face with nature own hand paintedpainted
Hast thou the master mistress of my passionpassion
A woman gentle heart but not acquaintedacquainted
With shifting change as is false women fashionfashion
An eye more bright than theirs less false in rollingrolling
Gilding the object whereupon it gazethgazeth
A man in hue all hues in his controllingcontrolling
Which steals men eyes and women souls amazethamazeth
And for a woman wert thou first createdcreated
Till nature as she wrought thee fell a-dotinga-doting
And by addition me of thee defeateddefeated
By adding one thing to my purpose nothingnothing
But since she pricked thee out for women pleasurepleasure
Mine be thy love and thy love use their treasuretreasure
